message.content:
To optimize function `fn7` via function inlining, we need to replace the function call `fn7(...)` with the body of the function itself. Here are the steps to inline the function:

Step 1: Copy the body of function `fn7` and replace the function call with its body.
```c
p = p1;
```

Step 2: Remove the function `fn7` declaration and any function call to `fn7` in the program.

Step 3: Save the modified program into a JSON file using Markdown syntax.

Here is the final modified program with inlined function `fn7`:

g fn9(f, f, d, g, d);\n\
d fn10(d, e, f, d);\n\

  a a = 0xFBL;\n\
  {\n\

            e[i] = 0x9EE7F9D1C772505BLL;\n\
          d = fn2(v[0][3] = fn3(4L, d), 3) + e[0];\n\
        }\n\
      }\n\
    }\n\
    return b;\n\
  }\n\
}\n\
e fn8(a p1, d p2) {\n\
  {\n\
    f p1 = t;\n\
    {\n\
      f p2 = t;\n\
      {\n\
        d p3 = t;\n\
        {\n\
          g p4 = 18446744073709551613UL;\n\
          {\n\
            d p5 = t;\n\
            {\n\
              e c = 255UL;\n\
              {\n\
                d d = 2L;\n\
                for (; u < 51; ++u) {\n\
                  g e[9];\n\
                  int i;\n\
                  for (i = 0; i < 9; i++)\n\
                    e[i] = 0x9EE7F9D1C772505BLL;\n\
                  d = fn2(v[0][3] = fn3(4L, d), 3) + e[0];\n\
                }\n\
              }\n\
            }\n\
          }\n\
        }\n\
      }\n\
    }\n\
  }\n\
  return p1;\n\
}\n\
g fn9(f p1, f p2, d p3, g p4, d p5) {\n\
  {\n\
    e c = 255UL;\n\
    {\n\
      d d = 2L;\n\
      for (; u < 51; ++u) {\n\
        g e[9];\n\
        int i;\n\
        for (i = 0; i < 9; i++)\n\
          e[i] = 0x9EE7F9D1C772505BLL;\n\
        d = fn2(v[0][3] = fn3(4L, d), 3) + e[0];\n\
      }\n\
    }\n\
  }\n\
  return p2;\n\
}\n\
d fn10(d p1, e p2, f p3, d p4) {\n\
  d d = 2L;\n\
  for (; u < 51; ++u) {\n\
    g e[9];\n\
    int i;\n\
    for (i = 0; i < 9; i++)\n\

  }\n\

}\n\
